data.enText: piece of wood etc.
a long thin piece of strong hard material, especially wood, used, for example, for making floors, building walls and roofs and making boats

data.chText: 他用力扯去了地毯，只剩下裸露的地板。
data.enText: He had ripped up the carpet, leaving only the bare boards.
a piece of wood, or other strong material, that is used for a special purpose
a blackboard
I'll write it up on the board.
a noticeboard
a bulletin board

data.chText: 考试成绩张贴在布告牌上。
data.enText: The exam results went up on the board.
a diving board

data.chText: 她从高层跳板上跳了下来。
data.enText: She jumped off the top board.
a chessboard

data.chText: 他从黑板上抹去了那个数字。
data.enText: He removed the figure from the board.
in water sports
group of people

data.chText: （公司或其他机构的）董事会，委员会，理事会

data.hoverText: 可与单数或复数动词连用的可数名词

data.enText: a group of people who have power to make decisions and control a company or other organization
She has a seat on the board of directors.

data.chText: 董事会对销售额下降感到不满。
data.enText: The board is/are unhappy about falling sales.
members of the board
discussions at board level
the academic board (= for example, of a British university)

data.chText: 管理地方公立学校的教育委员会
data.enText: the Board of Education (= a group of elected officials who are in charge of all the public schools in a particular area)
organization
used in the name of some organizations
the Welsh Tourist Board (= responsible for giving tourist information)
meals

data.chText: （旅馆、招待所等提供的）伙食，膳食；膳食费用
data.enText: the meals that are provided when you stay in a hotel, guest house , etc.; what you pay for the meals

data.chText: 他每周的膳宿花费为90英镑。
data.enText: He pays £90 a week board and lodging.
exams
exams that you take when you apply to go to college in the US
in theatre
the stage in a theatre

data.chText: 他的戏剧搬上了百老汇的舞台。
data.enText: His play is on the boards on Broadway.
She's treading the boards (= working as an actress) .
ice hockey
the low wooden wall surrounding the area where a game of ice hockey is played

data.chText: 冰球击偏了，打在了界墙上。
data.enText: The puck went wide, hitting the boards.

data.text: There are many other compounds ending in board . You will find them at their place in the alphabet.
以board结尾的复合词还有很多，可在各字母中的适当位置查到。

data.enText: across the board
involving everyone or everything in a company, an industry, etc.

data.chText: 这一行业需要全面增加投资。
data.enText: The industry needs more investment across the board.
an across-the-board wage increase
go by the board
to be rejected or ignored; to be no longer possible

data.chText: 她力图保持和颜悦色的一切努力都白费了，于是她开始大喊大叫。
data.enText: All her efforts to be polite went by the board and she started to shout.
on board

data.chText: 在船上（或飞机上、火车上）
data.enText: on or in a ship, an aircraft or a train
Have the passengers gone on board yet ?

data.chText: 这项工程有你和我们携手合作真是太好了。
data.enText: It's good to have you on board (= working with us) for this project.
take sth on board
to accept and understand an idea or a suggestion

data.chText: 我把我的想法告诉了她，可她没有听取我的建议。
data.enText: I told her what I thought, but she didn't take my advice on board.
sweep the board
to win all the prizes, etc. in a competition
get on plane/ship, etc.

data.chText: 上船（或火车、飞机、公共汽车等）
data.enText: to get on a ship, train, plane, bus, etc.

data.chText: 海关官员登上了这艘船。
data.enText: The ship was boarded by customs officials.
Passengers are waiting to board.
when a plane or ship is boarding , it is ready for passengers to get on

data.chText: BA193次飞往巴黎的乘客现在可以在37号登机口登机。
data.enText: Flight BA193 for Paris is now boarding at Gate 37.
live somewhere
to live and take meals in sb's home, in return for payment

data.chText: 她的家总有一两名寄宿学生。
data.enText: She always had one or two students boarding with her.
to live at a school during the school year
board sb out
to arrange for sb to live somewhere away from their place of work, school, etc. in return for payment
board sth↔up
to cover a window, door, etc. with wooden boards

means: (公司或其他机构的)董事会，委员会，理事会
上船(或火车、飞机、公共汽车等)

ex.chText: 在纽约，你有没有在深夜单独乘过地铁？
ex.enText: In New York, did you ever take the subway alone late at night?
I would rather take the plane.

ex.chText: 到十字路口走右边的岔道。
ex.enText: Take the right fork at the crossroads.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，指乘坐某种交通工具或走某条道路。

ex.chText: 我和德雷克决定乘火车去日内瓦。
ex.enText: Drake and I decided to board a train for Geneva.

ex.chText: 我们加入到等候上船的旅客队伍中。
ex.enText: We joined the passengers waiting to board.

ex.chText: 他起得很早，以便赶上头班火车。
ex.enText: He got up very early so as to catch the first train.

ex.chText: 他突然发现时间很晚，赶不上末班公共汽车了。
ex.enText: He suddenly discovered that it was too late to catch the last bus.

ex.chText: 她正要离开办公室去赶飞往伦敦的一班飞机。
ex.enText: She was about to leave the office to catch a flight to London.

synonyms.bx: 指及时登上飞机、火车、公共汽车等。

ex.chText: 他们一早就登上了开往迈阿密的轮船。
ex.enText: Early in the morning they embarked the ship for Miami.

ex.chText: 这艘船载有旅客和货物。
ex.enText: This ship embarked passengers and cargoes.

synonyms.bx: 主要指乘船，也可指船载运旅客、货物。

ex.enText: A ticket inspector got on the train.

ex.chText: 当公共汽车到站时，一些乘客上了车。
ex.enText: When the bus came to a stop, some passengers got on.
We got on the plane at Paris.

synonyms.bx: 指上车、船、飞机等，多用于非正式文体。

data.enText: across the board
involving everyone or everything in a company, an industry, etc.

data.chText: 这一行业需要全面增加投资。
data.enText: The industry needs more investment across the board.
an across-the-board wage increase
go by the board
to be rejected or ignored; to be no longer possible

data.chText: 她力图保持和颜悦色的一切努力都白费了，于是她开始大喊大叫。
data.enText: All her efforts to be polite went by the board and she started to shout.
on board

data.chText: 在船上（或飞机上、火车上）
data.enText: on or in a ship, an aircraft or a train
Have the passengers gone on board yet ?

data.chText: 这项工程有你和我们携手合作真是太好了。
data.enText: It's good to have you on board (= working with us) for this project.
take sth on board
to accept and understand an idea or a suggestion

data.chText: 我把我的想法告诉了她，可她没有听取我的建议。
data.enText: I told her what I thought, but she didn't take my advice on board.
sweep the board
to win all the prizes, etc. in a competition
board sb out
to arrange for sb to live somewhere away from their place of work, school, etc. in return for payment
board sth↔up
to cover a window, door, etc. with wooden boards

tr: a flat piece of material designed for a special purpose
example: he nailed boards across the windows

tr: a flat portable surface (usually rectangular) designed for board games
example: he got out the board and set up the pieces

tr: a printed circuit that can be inserted into expansion slots in a computer to increase the computer's capabilities
electrical device consisting of a flat insulated surface that contains switches and dials and meters for controlling other electrical devices
example: suddenly the board lit up like a Christmas tree

tr: a table at which meals are served
example: he helped her clear the dining table
a feast was spread upon the board

tr: a vertical surface on which information can be displayed to public view
a stout length of sawn timber
made in a wide variety of sizes and used for many purposes

example: The old lady is boarding three men

tr: get on board of (trains, buses, ships, aircraft, etc.)
live and take one's meals at or in
example: she rooms in an old boarding house

value.def: A board is a flat, thin, rectangular piece of wood or plastic which is used for a particular purpose.

example.ex: ...a chopping board.
example.tran: 砧板

value.tran: （有特殊用途的）木板，塑料板，板材

value.def: A board is a square piece of wood or stiff cardboard that you use for playing games such as chess.

example.ex: ...a draughts board...
example.tran: 跳棋棋盘

example.ex: Dr Tinsley had five pieces on the board against Chinook's four.
example.tran: 廷斯利博士在棋盘上还有5枚棋子，对手钦诺克还有4枚。

value.tran: （下棋等用的）木板，硬纸板，棋盘

value.def: You can refer to a blackboard or a noticeboard as a board.

example.ex: He wrote a few more notes on the board.
example.tran: 他在黑板上又写了几条注释。

value.def: Boards are long flat pieces of wood which are used, for example, to make floors or walls.

example.ex: The floor was draughty bare boards.
example.tran: 地面铺的是透气性好的实木地板。

value.tran: （用来铺地板、筑围墙等的）长条木板

value.def: The board of a company or organization is the group of people who control it and direct it.

example.ex: Arthur wants to put his recommendation before the board at a meeting tomorrow.
example.tran: 阿瑟希望在明天的会议上把自己的建议书提交董事会。

example.ex: ...the agenda for the September 12 board meeting.
example.tran: 9月12日董事会议的议程

value.def: Board is used in the names of various organizations which are involved in dealing with a particular kind of activity.

example.ex: The Scottish Tourist Board said 33,000 Japanese visited Scotland last year.
example.tran: 苏格兰旅游局宣称去年有33,000名日本人到苏格兰旅游。

example.ex: ...the US National Transportation Safety Board.
example.tran: 美国国家交通运输安全委员会

value.tran: （用于机构名称中）局，所，中心，委员会

value.def: When you board a train, ship, or aircraft, you get on it in order to travel somewhere.

example.ex: I boarded the plane bound for England.
example.tran: 我登上了飞往英格兰的飞机。

value.tran: 上，登上（火车、轮船或飞机）

value.def: Board is the food which is provided when you stay somewhere, for example in a hotel.

example.ex: Free room and board are provided for all hotel staff.
example.tran: 宾馆的所有员工都可享受免费膳宿。

value.def: An arrangement or deal that is above board is legal and is being carried out honestly and openly.

example.ex: All I knew about were Antony's own financial dealings, which were always above board.
example.tran: 据我所知，安东尼经手的金融交易一直是公开透明的。

value.tran: （协议或交易）合法诚信的，公开的，光明正大的

value.def: If a policy or a situation applies across the board, it affects everything or everyone in a particular group.

example.ex: There are hefty charges across the board for one-way rental...
example.tran: 各处对单程租赁的收费都很高。

example.ex: The President promised across-the-board tax cuts if re-elected.
example.tran: 总统许诺如果能再次当选将采取全面的减税措施。

gramarinfo.label: usu PHR after v, PHR n

value.def: If something goes by the board, it is rejected or ignored, or is no longer possible.

example.ex: It's a case of not what you know but who you know in this world today and qualifications quite go by the board.
example.tran: 在当今这个世界，重要的不是你知道什么而是你认识谁，能力才干根本派不上用场。

value.def: When you are on board a train, ship, or aircraft, you are on it or in it.

example.ex: They arrived at Gatwick airport on board a plane chartered by the Italian government...
example.tran: 他们乘坐意大利政府的包机到达盖特威克机场。

example.ex: ...a naval task force with two thousand marines on board.
example.tran: 由2,000名海军陆战队士兵组成的海军特遣队

gramarinfo.label: PHR after v, v-link PHR, oft PHR n

value.def: If someone sweeps the board in a competition or election, they win nearly everything that it is possible to win.

example.ex: Spain swept the board in boys' team competitions.
example.tran: 西班牙队在男子团体比赛中大获全胜。

value.tran: （在竞赛或选举中）取得压倒性胜利，大获全胜

value.def: If you take on board an idea or a problem, you begin to accept it or understand it.

example.ex: I hope that they will take on board some of what you have said.
example.tran: 我希望他们能采纳你们所提出的部分想法。

example.ex: Half the shops are boarded up on the estate's small shopping street.
example.tran: 在该住宅区的小型购物街上有一半商店都已封上了门窗。

example.ex: ...the boarded-up houses and the derelict factories of Merseyside.
example.tran: 默西赛德郡封上门窗的房屋和废弃的工厂

trans: 船上；在火车（或轮船、飞机）上
董事会；在董事会；在会上讨论；在黑板上
